BiomeDef.label: tropical rainforest
BiomeDef.description: A thick, moist jungle, buzzing with animal life and infested with disease. Despite its visual beauty, this is a very dangerous biome. Choking overgrowth, aggressive animals, and constant sickness are why some explorers call this the "green hell".

BiomeDef.label: tropical swamp
BiomeDef.description: A plant-choked, steamy swamp seething with parasites and pathogens. Much of the land is too marshy to build on. Difficult movement, aggressive animals, and rampant disease make living here a nightmare.

BiomeDef.label: arid shrubland
BiomeDef.description: A dry region, but not dry enough to become a true desert. Open plains with grasses and bushes give way to scattered groves of trees. Plants are hardy and there is a moderate density of animals, but arable soil is hard to find.

BiomeDef.label: desert
BiomeDef.description: A very dry area which supports little life. There is very little arable land, and animal life is very sparse. Deserts can be hot, or quite cold.

BiomeDef.label: extreme desert
BiomeDef.description: An extremely hot, dry area, devoid of almost all life. Searing heat and a near total lack of arable land make it very difficult to survive here.

BiomeDef.label: boreal forest
BiomeDef.description: Coniferous forests are almost entirely composed of coniferous trees. It is quite cold here in winter, but the variety of animals is impressive.

BiomeDef.label: tundra
BiomeDef.description: These mostly-frozen plains bear almost no trees and little vegetation. There are a few small animals interspersed with large herds of migratory grazers and their predators.

BiomeDef.label: cold bog
BiomeDef.description: A wetland packed with trees and vines. Much of the marshy land here can't support heavy structures, moving around is slow due to choking vegetation. Disease is endemic in this dense, wet ecosystem.

BiomeDef.label: ice sheet
BiomeDef.description: Sheets of ice which can be kilometers thick. There is no soil for plants to grow in. The only animals here are migrating to somewhere else - or badly lost.

BiomeDef.label: sea ice
BiomeDef.description: Permanent ice sheets floating on water. There is no soil for plants to grow, no minerals to mine, and almost no animal life.

BiomeDef.label: temperate forest
BiomeDef.description: These forests are home to many plants and animals, with a rich ecosystem and normal weather conditions.

BiomeDef.label: temperate swamp
BiomeDef.description: Wetlands choked with vegetation and disease. Dense overgrowth makes it hard to move around, and clearing areas for building takes a long time. Much of the terrain is too marshy to support heavy structures.
